quote: The superpowers often behave like two heavily armed blind men feeling their way around a room, each believing himself in mortal peril from the other, whom he assumes to have perfect vision.
author: Henry Kissinger

quote: Reasonable men adapt to the world around them unreasonable men make the world adapt to them. The world is changed by unreasonable men.
author: Edwin Louis Cole

quote: Men and girls, men and girls: Artificial swine and pearls.
author: Gertrude Stein

quote: None can love freedom heartily, but good men; the rest love not freedom, but licence.
author: John Milton

quote: Barking dogs occasionally bite, but laughing men hardly ever shoot.
author: Konrad Lorenz

quote: My dad's a beautiful man, but like a lot of Mexican men, or men in general, a lot of men have a problem with the balance of masculinity and femininity - intuition and compassion and tenderness - and get overboard with the macho thing. It took him a while to become more, I would say, conscious, evolved.
author: Carlos Santana

quote: I love to tease men with my legs.
author: Eartha Kitt

quote: When I got old enough to date, I realized that Valentine's Day is just a commercial marketing scam to make men feel bad. So I let my boyfriends off the hook.
author: Evangeline Lilly

quote: When I look up and see the sun shining on the patch of white clouds up in the blue, I begin to think how it would feel to be up somewhere above it winging swiftly thought the clear air, watching the earth below, and the men on it, no bigger than ants.
author: Eddie Rickenbacker

quote: Those who profess to favor freedom, and yet deprecate agitation, are men who want crops without plowing up the ground.
author: Frederick Douglass

quote: Scientists are not delinquents. Our work has changed the conditions in which men live, but the use made of these changes is the problem of governments, not of scientists.
author: J. Robert Oppenheimer

quote: Some men say that they should be satisfied with the abolition of untouchability only, leaving the caste system alone. The aim of abolition of untouchability alone without trying to abolish the inequalities inherent in the caste system is a rather low aim.
author: B. R. Ambedkar

quote: Men don't pay attention to small things.
author: Katherine Johnson

quote: For my generation, the bomber jacket is like a replacement for the suit jacket. It's a piece that men wear every day, and it's something that I would wear for any occasion, whether it's on the street or going to an awards ceremony.
author: The Weeknd

quote: Millions of men have lived to fight, build palaces and boundaries, shape destinies and societies; but the compelling force of all times has been the force of originality and creation profoundly affecting the roots of human spirit.
author: Ansel Adams

quote: Brave men are all vertebrates they have their softness on the surface and their toughness in the middle.
author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

quote: I've come to accept that the life of a frontrunner is a hard one, that he will suffer more injuries than most men and that many of these injuries will not be accidental.
author: Pele

quote: Men who never get carried away should be.
author: Malcolm Forbes

quote: I know many married men, I even know a few happily married men, but I don't know one who wouldn't fall down the first open coal hole running after the first pretty girl who gave him a wink.
author: George Jean Nathan

quote: Some men storm imaginary Alps all their lives, and die in the foothills cursing difficulties which do not exist.
author: E. W. Howe

quote: Who is to say that 5 men 10 years ago were right whereas 5 men looking the other direction today are wrong.
author: Harry A. Blackmun

quote: If there is a single quality that is shared by all great men, it is vanity.
author: Yousuf Karsh

quote: As a vessel is known by the sound, whether it be cracked or not; so men are proved, by their speeches, whether they be wise or foolish.
author: Demosthenes

quote: In Greece wise men speak and fools decide.
author: George Santayana

quote: Some men have thousands of reasons why they cannot do what they want to, when all they need is one reason why they can.
author: Martha Graham

quote: Kindly words do not enter so deeply into men as a reputation for kindness.
author: Mencius

quote: Man is not the creature of circumstances, circumstances are the creatures of men. We are free agents, and man is more powerful than matter.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: I don't want to be a silly temptress. I cannot see any sense in getting dressed up and doing nothing but tempting men in pictures.
author: Greta Garbo

quote: There are two men inside the artist, the poet and the craftsman. One is born a poet. One becomes a craftsman.
author: Emile Zola

quote: On a group of theories one can found a school; but on a group of values one can found a culture, a civilization, a new way of living together among men.
author: Ignazio Silone

quote: All the problems of the world could be settled easily if men were only willing to think. The trouble is that men very often resort to all sorts of devices in order not to think, because thinking is such hard work.
author: Thomas J. Watson

quote: By nature, men love newfangledness.
author: Geoffrey Chaucer

quote: By burning Luther's books you may rid your bookshelves of him, but you will not rid men's minds of him.
author: Desiderius Erasmus

quote: I dress for the image. Not for myself, not for the public, not for fashion, not for men.
author: Marlene Dietrich

quote: Men are beasts and even beasts don't behave as they do.
author: Brigitte Bardot

quote: Certainly the best works, and of greatest merit for the public, have proceeded from the unmarried, or childless men.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: Law describes the way things would work if men were angels.
author: Christopher Dawson

quote: If there existed no external means for dimming their consciences, one-half of the men would at once shoot themselves, because to live contrary to one's reason is a most intolerable state, and all men of our time are in such a state.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Justice consists in doing no injury to men decency in giving them no offense.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: The truth is found when men are free to pursue it.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quote: The integrity of men is to be measured by their conduct, not by their professions.
author: Junius

quote: You can talk about teamwork on a baseball team, but I'll tell you, it takes teamwork when you have 2,900 men stationed on the U.S.S. Alabama in the South Pacific.
author: Bob Feller

quote: As soon as laws are necessary for men, they are no longer fit for freedom.
author: Pythagoras

quote: If the whole of mankind is to be united into one brotherhood, all obstacles must be removed so that men, all over the surface of the globe, should be as children playing in a garden.
author: Maria Montessori

quote: Men exist for the sake of one another.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: We know that we cannot live together without rules which tell us what is right and what is wrong, what is permitted and what is prohibited. We know that it is law which enables men to live together, that creates order out of chaos. We know that law is the glue that holds civilization together.
author: Robert Kennedy

quote: Many men fail because they do not see the importance of being kind and courteous to the men under them. Kindness to everybody always pays for itself. And, besides, it is a pleasure to be kind.
author: Charles M. Schwab

quote: Automation provides us with wondrous increases of production and information, but does it tell us what to do with the men the machines displace? Modern industry gives us the capacity for unparalleled wealth - but where is our capacity to make that wealth meaningful to the poor of every nation?
author: Robert Kennedy

quote: Men do not shape destiny, Destiny produces the man for the hour.
author: Fidel Castro

quote: Honor is simply the morality of superior men.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: In the Muslim world, I had seen that men with white complexions were more genuinely brotherly than anyone else had ever been. That... was the start of a radical alteration in my whole outlook about 'white men.'
author: Malcolm X

quote: There's a lot of females that hustle, just like men hustle.
author: Fetty Wap

quote: If help and salvation are to come, they can only come from the children, for the children are the makers of men.
author: Maria Montessori

quote: Literature is strewn with the wreckage of men who have minded beyond reason the opinions of others.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: Men of ill judgment ignore the good that lies within their hands, till they have lost it.
author: Sophocles

quote: Men are so simple and yield so readily to the desires of the moment that he who will trick will always find another who will suffer to be tricked.
author: Niccolo Machiavelli

quote: You have young men of color in many communities who are more likely to end up in jail or in the criminal justice system than they are in a good job or in college. And, you know, part of my job, that I can do, I think, without any potential conflicts, is to get at those root causes.
author: Barack Obama

quote: The world would be happier if men had the same capacity to be silent that they have to speak.
author: Baruch Spinoza

quote: The mother must socialize her daughter to become subordinate to men, and if her daughter challenges patriarchal norms, the mother is likely to defend the patriarchal structures against her own daughters.
author: Carol P. Christ

quote: Where all men think alike, no one thinks very much.
author: Walter Lippmann

quote: The history of free men is never really written by chance but by choice their choice!
author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

quote: Unjust attacks on public men do them more good than unmerited praise.
author: Rutherford B. Hayes

quote: Boxing is a lot of white men watching two black men beat each other up.
author: Muhammad Ali

quote: I therefore claim to show, not how men think in myths, but how myths operate in men's minds without their being aware of the fact.
author: Claude Levi-Strauss

quote: Men create the gods in their own image.
author: Xenophanes

quote: Men who are too good looking are never good in bed because they never had to be.
author: Sarah Jessica Parker

quote: Men blush less for their crimes than for their weaknesses and vanity.
author: Jean de la Bruyere

quote: I don't think feminism, as I understand the definition, implies the rejection of maternal values, nurturing children, caring about the men in your life. That is just nonsense to me.
author: Hillary Clinton

quote: There is a solid satisfaction in one's having and being conscious that he merits the good opinion of men of true discernment and real worth. But to have a name among the weak and the wicked is shame and reproach.
author: Samuel Adams

quote: Fishes live in the sea, as men do on land: the great ones eat up the little ones.
author: Pericles

quote: My native land is a slave of heathenism, men's god is their belly, and they live only for the present. The richer a man, the holier.
author: St. Jerome

quote: I only like two kinds of men, domestic and imported.
author: Mae West

quote: We cannot be kind to each other here for even an hour. We whisper, and hint, and chuckle and grin at our brother's shame; however you take it we men are a little breed.
author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

quote: I believe in work, hard work, and long hours of work. Men do not breakdown from overwork, but from worry and dissipation.
author: Charles Evans Hughes

quote: It is not reasonable that those who gamble with men's lives should not pay with their own.
author: H. G. Wells

quote: When my young men began the killing, my heart was hurt.
author: Chief Joseph

quote: You talk about American technocracy and you find men on the moon, not once, but several times... and safely home again.
author: Gordon Sinclair

quote: Men always do leave off really thinking, when the last bit of wild animal dies in them.
author: D. H. Lawrence

quote: Some men do think I'm a psycho bunny-boiler.
author: Amy Winehouse

quote: I can paint pictures, but I cannot rule men.
author: Fra Angelico

quote: Most men are within a finger's breadth of being mad.
author: Diogenes

quote: The world owes all its onward impulses to men ill at ease. The happy man inevitably confines himself within ancient limits.
author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

quote: Many years ago, I concluded that a few hair shirts were part of the mental wardrobe of every man. The president differs from other men in that he has a more extensive wardrobe.
author: Herbert Hoover

quote: I am fed up with men who use sex like a sleeping pill.
author: Toni Braxton

quote: It will be of little avail to the people that the laws are made by men of their own choice if the laws be so voluminous that they cannot be read, or so incoherent that they cannot be understood.
author: James Madison

quote: The men who abandon themselves to the passions of this miserable life, are compared in Scripture to beasts.
author: Peter Abelard

quote: Deliberation is the work of many men. Action, of one alone.
author: Charles de Gaulle

quote: If the world were a logical place, men would ride side saddle.
author: Rita Mae Brown

quote: The public weal requires that men should betray, and lie, and massacre.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: That all men are equal is a proposition to which, at ordinary times, no sane human being has ever given his assent.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: Like all weak men he laid an exaggerated stress on not changing one's mind.
author: W. Somerset Maugham

quote: All those men have their price.
author: Robert Walpole

quote: What, but the rapacity of the only men who exercised their reason, the priests, secured such vast property to the church, when a man gave his perishable substance to save himself from the dark torments of purgatory.
author: Mary Wollstonecraft

quote: It's almost like a lot of black people in America, a lot of young black men, are born with this cloud over their heads. It's their penitentiary cloud, this philosophy we all have, that it's harder for us.
author: Erykah Badu

quote: The great and unlooked for discoveries that have taken place of late years have all concurred to lead many men into the opinion that we were touching on a period big with the most important changes.
author: Thomas Malthus

quote: The fears of one class of men are not the measure of the rights of another.
author: George Bancroft

quote: Reflection makes men cowards.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: The fact is, when men carry the same ideals in their hearts, nothing can isolate them - neither prison walls nor the sod of cemeteries. For a single memory, a single spirit, a single idea, a single conscience, a single dignity will sustain them all.
author: Fidel Castro

quote: I do not consider it an insult, but rather a compliment to be called an agnostic. I do not pretend to know where many ignorant men are sure - that is all that agnosticism means.
author: Clarence Darrow

quote: Love rules the court, the camp, the grove, And men below, and saints above: For love is heaven, and heaven is love.
author: Walter Scott

quote: Ignorant people see life as either existence or non-existence, but wise men see it beyond both existence and non-existence to something that transcends them both; this is an observation of the Middle Way.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: Men stumble over pebbles, never over mountains.
author: Marilyn French

quote: You can employ men and hire hands to work for you, but you must win their hearts to have them work with you.
author: Merle Shain

quote: Men should be like Kleenex, soft, strong and disposable.
author: Cher

quote: Too often I would hear men boast of the miles covered that day, rarely of what they had seen.
author: Louis L'Amour

quote: Be thou incapable of change in that which is right, and men will rely upon thee. Establish unto thyself principles of action; and see that thou ever act according to them. First know that thy principles are just, and then be thou.
author: Akhenaton

quote: Nothing is as peevish and pedantic as men's judgments of one another.
author: Desiderius Erasmus

quote: By indignities men come to dignities.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: Circumstances rule men men do not rule circumstances.
author: Herodotus

quote: Men are not punished for their sins, but by them.
author: Kin Hubbard

quote: Most men, when they think they are thinking, are merely rearranging their prejudices.
author: Knute Rockne

quote: Men do not quit playing because they grow old they grow old because they quit playing.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.

quote: Men are like sheep, of which a flock is more easily driven than a single one.
author: Richard Whately

quote: Men do not fail they give up trying.
author: Elihu Root

quote: Men often act knowingly against their interest.
author: David Hume

quote: Men, who are rogues individually, are in the mass very honorable people.
author: Charles de Secondat

quote: Men won't read any email from a woman that's over 200 words long.
author: Douglas Coupland

quote: A chief is a man who assumes responsibility. He says 'I was beaten', he does not say 'My men were beaten.'
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

quote: What's with you men? Would hair stop growing on your chest if you asked directions somewhere?
author: Erma Bombeck

quote: In department stores, so much kitchen equipment is bought indiscriminately by people who just come in for men's underwear.
author: Julia Child

quote: When men are full of envy they disparage everything, whether it be good or bad.
author: Tacitus

quote: Of all men's miseries the bitterest is this: to know so much and to have control over nothing.
author: Herodotus

quote: What distinguishes the majority of men from the few is their inability to act according to their beliefs.
author: John Stuart Mill

quote: Those who excel in virtue have the best right of all to rebel, but then they are of all men the least inclined to do so.
author: Aristotle

quote: I don't think there are any men who are faithful to their wives.
author: Jackie Kennedy

quote: Diamonds never leave you... men do!
author: Shirley Bassey

quote: More men fail through lack of purpose than lack of talent.
author: Billy Sunday

quote: Once men are caught up in an event, they cease to be afraid. Only the unknown frightens men.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

quote: Nine men in ten are would be suicides.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Men give away nothing so liberally as their advice.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quote: Women prefer to talk in twos, while men prefer to talk in threes.
author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

quote: I only have 'yes' men around me. Who needs 'no' men?
author: Mae West

quote: Men are freest when they are most unconscious of freedom. The shout is a rattling of chains, always was.
author: D. H. Lawrence

quote: In life we shall find many men that are great, and some that are good, but very few men that are both great and good.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote: Men's arguments often prove nothing but their wishes.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote: The country is filled with energetic and enterprising men, rendered desperate by being reduced from affluence to poverty through the vicissitudes of the times. They will give an impulse to smuggling unknown to the country heretofore.
author: John C. Calhoun

quote: On this shrunken globe, men can no longer live as strangers.
author: Adlai E. Stevenson

quote: One must judge men not by their opinions, but by what their opinions have made of them.
author: Georg C. Lichtenberg

quote: Whatever crushes individuality is despotism, by whatever name it may be called and whether it professes to be enforcing the will of God or the injunctions of men.
author: John Stuart Mill

quote: Men tend to feel threatened women tend to feel guilty.
author: Edwin Louis Cole

quote: What is the most beautiful in virile men is something feminine what is most beautiful in feminine women is something masculine.
author: Susan Sontag

quote: Boys will be boys, and so will a lot of middle-aged men.
author: Kin Hubbard

quote: All men were made by the Great Spirit Chief. They are all brothers.
author: Chief Joseph

quote: There is always a type of man who says he loves his fellow men, and expects to make a living at it.
author: E. W. Howe

quote: Men have as exaggerated an idea of their rights as women have of their wrongs.
author: E. W. Howe

quote: Lonely women destroy themselves lonely men threaten the world.
author: Victor LaValle

quote: It is only the great men who are truly obscene. If they had not dared to be obscene, they could never have dared to be great.
author: Havelock Ellis

quote: It is easier to lead men to combat, stirring up their passion, than to restrain them and direct them toward the patient labors of peace.
author: Andre Gide

quote: When two men in business always agree, one of them is unnecessary.
author: Ezra Pound

quote: Life, in my estimation, is a biological misadventure that we terminate on the shoulders of six strange men whose only objective is to make a hole in one with you.
author: Fred Allen

quote: Whatever makes men good Christians, makes them good citizens.
author: Daniel Webster

quote: Men may live fools, but fools they cannot die.
author: Edward Young

quote: Men, even when alone, lighten their labors by song, however rude it may be.
author: Quintilian

quote: Men tire themselves in pursuit of rest.
author: Laurence Sterne

quote: Homosexuality in Russia is a crime and the punishment is seven years in prison, locked up with the other men. There is a three year waiting list.
author: Yakov Smirnoff

quote: Every man is a volume if you know how to read him.
author: William Ellery Channing

quote: Men are actually the weaker sex.
author: George Weinberg

quote: A lot of times, women don't get the male perspective in regards to a relationship, what men go through when they're not really dealing well.
author: Morris Chestnut

quote: Italian men do appreciate beautiful women. They're not afraid of the beauty, which is nice.
author: Eva Herzigova

quote: All men have an instinct for conflict: at least, all healthy men.
author: Hilaire Belloc

quote: Women thrive on novelty and are easy meat for the commerce of fashion. Men prefer old pipes and torn jackets.
author: Anthony Burgess

quote: Culture makes all men gentle.
author: Menander

quote: Like all young men I set out to be a genius, but mercifully laughter intervened.
author: Lawrence Durrell

quote: First find the man in yourself if you will inspire manliness in others.
author: Amos Bronson Alcott

quote: There will always be men struggling to change, and there will always be those who are controlled by the past.
author: Ernest Gaines

quote: For most men life is a search for the proper manila envelope in which to get themselves filed.
author: Clifton Fadiman

quote: Whenever ideas fail, men invent words.
author: Martin H. Fischer

quote: Every time a man expects, as he says, his money to work for him, he is expecting other people to work for him.
author: Dorothy L. Sayers

quote: Either men will learn to live like brothers, or they will die like beasts.
author: Max Lerner

quote: A dress makes no sense unless it inspires men to take it off of you.
author: Francoise Sagan

quote: Men are different. When they are in love they may also have other girlfriends.
author: Zhang Ziyi

quote: No nice men are good at getting taxis.
author: Katharine Whitehorn

quote: He was one of those men who possess almost every gift, except the gift of the power to use them.
author: Charles Kingsley

quote: Men are not against you they are merely for themselves.
author: Gene Fowler

quote: What do women do when they get together? We sit around and talk! Men, not so much. My theory is that this difference is genetic and dates back to the hunter-gatherer societies, when the men had to be quiet as they hunted, lest they scare away the bison and then everyone starved to death and it was all their fault.
author: Jenna McCarthy

quote: The beauty of a strong, lasting commitment is often best understood by men incapable of it.
author: Murray Kempton

quote: When a man is no longer anxious to do better than well, he is done for.
author: Benjamin Haydon

quote: You will not be punished for your anger, you will be punished by your anger.
author: Buddha

quote: While seeking revenge, dig two graves - one for yourself.
author: Douglas Horton

quote: When anger rises, think of the consequences.
author: Confucius

quote: Anger is the enemy of non-violence and pride is a monster that swallows it up.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Holding on to anger is like grasping a hot coal with the intent of throwing it at someone else you are the one who gets burned.
author: Buddha

quote: I don't usually lose my temper, but if I get angry, it's true - I'm scary.
author: Eva Mendes

quote: Anger and intolerance are the enemies of correct understanding.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: It is wise to direct your anger towards problems - not people to focus your energies on answers - not excuses.
author: William Arthur Ward

quote: Silence is one of the hardest arguments to refute.
author: Josh Billings

quote: I shall allow no man to belittle my soul by making me hate him.
author: Booker T. Washington

quote: There's a natural law of karma that vindictive people, who go out of their way to hurt others, will end up broke and alone.
author: Sylvester Stallone

quote: Whatever is begun in anger ends in shame.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: When angry count to ten before you speak. If very angry, count to one hundred.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: Depression, suffering and anger are all part of being human.
author: Janet Fitch

quote: For me, comedy starts as a spew, a kind of explosion, and then you sculpt it from there, if at all. It comes out of a deeper, darker side. Maybe it comes from anger, because I'm outraged by cruel absurdities, the hypocrisy that exists everywhere, even within yourself, where it's hardest to see.
author: Robin Williams

quote: Yesterday, we fought wars which destroyed cities. Today, we are concerned with avoiding a war which will destroy the earth. We can adapt atomic energy to produce electricity and move ships, but can we control its use in anger?
author: Robert Kennedy

quote: A man that studieth revenge keeps his own wounds green.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: The opposite of anger is not calmness, its empathy.
author: Mehmet Oz

quote: I have sadness in me. I have anger in me. I have heartbreak in me.
author: Ellen DeGeneres

quote: The ignorant mind, with its infinite afflictions, passions, and evils, is rooted in the three poisons. Greed, anger, and delusion.
author: Bodhidharma

quote: When I am angry I can pray well and preach well.
author: Martin Luther

quote: One of man's greatest obligations is anger.
author: Nikos Kazantzakis

quote: Guilt is anger directed at ourselves - at what we did or did not do. Resentment is anger directed at others - at what they did or did not do.
author: Peter McWilliams

quote: Anger is like a storm rising up from the bottom of your consciousness. When you feel it coming, turn your focus to your breath.
author: Thich Nhat Hanh

quote: Anger dwells only in the bosom of fools.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: When a man points a finger at someone else, he should remember that four of his fingers are pointing at himself.
author: Louis Nizer

quote: Generally speaking, if a human being never shows anger, then I think something's wrong. He's not right in the brain.
author: Dalai Lama

quote: As a human being, anger is a part of our mind. Irritation also part of our mind. But you can do - anger come, go. Never keep in your sort of - your inner world, then create a lot of suspicion, a lot of distrust, a lot of negative things, more worry.
author: Dalai Lama

quote: Anger is never without a reason, but seldom with a good one.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Good satire comes from anger. It comes from a sense of injustice, that there are wrongs in the world that need to be fixed. And what better place to get that well of venom and outrage boiling than a newsroom, because you're on the front lines.
author: Carl Hiaasen

quote: I think everybody should have the same anger towards the injustice that's happening and the hatred that's happening, and just fight it with love and compassion.
author: Ellen DeGeneres

quote: Words, especially when yelled in anger, can be very damaging to a child's self-confidence. The child probably already feels bad enough just from seeing the consequences of his or her behavior. Our sons and daughters don't need more guilt and self-doubt heaped upon their already wounded egos.
author: Jack Canfield

quote: Getting angry doesn't solve anything.
author: Grace Kelly

quote: Heaven has no rage like love to hatred turned, nor hell a fury like a woman scorned.
author: William Congreve

quote: When one burns one's bridges, what a very nice fire it makes.
author: Dylan Thomas

quote: Don't get the impression that you arouse my anger. You see, one can only be angry with those he respects.
author: Richard M. Nixon

quote: The flame of anger, bright and brief, sharpens the barb of love.
author: Walter Savage Landor

quote: I always channeled what I felt emotionally into skiing - my insecurities, my anger, my disappointment. Skiing was always my outlet, and it worked.
author: Lindsey Vonn

quote: I do stand up sometimes out of anger. Sometimes the greatest stuff comes from a dark place.
author: Tracy Morgan

quote: He who angers you conquers you.
author: Elizabeth Kenny

quote: You feel the shame, humiliation, and anger at being just another victim of prejudice, and at the same time, there's the nagging worry that maybe... you're just no good.
author: Nina Simone

quote: We boil at different degrees.
author: Clint Eastwood

quote: Get mad, then get over it.
author: Colin Powell

quote: A man that does not know how to be angry does not know how to be good.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: Anger is a killing thing: it kills the man who angers, for each rage leaves him less than he had been before - it takes something from him.
author: Louis L'Amour

quote: There is nothing that so much gratifies an ill tongue as when it finds an angry heart.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: Indulge not thyself in the passion of anger; it is whetting a sword to wound thine own breast, or murder thy friend.
author: Akhenaton

quote: As you get older, you see the world at a different angle, maybe more cynically, but I just bury my anger.
author: Zach Galifianakis

quote: Denial, panic, threats, anger - those are very human responses to feeling guilt.
author: Joshua Oppenheimer

quote: Con men look for human frailty to exploit. This is most often greed. Trump found a different vice: anger. The emotional are always the most susceptible to manipulation.
author: Pamela Meyer

quote: If you get down and quarell everyday, you're saying prayers to the devil, I say.
author: Bob Marley

quote: It seems to me that election season is just a Petri dish for anger and cynicism.
author: Max Lucado

quote: The one who cannot restrain their anger will wish undone, what their temper and irritation prompted them to do.
author: Horace

quote: Revenge is often like biting a dog because the dog bit you.
author: Austin O'Malley

quote: Sometimes it's worse to win a fight than to lose.
author: Billie Holiday

quote: Anger makes dull men witty, but it keeps them poor.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: Be calm in arguing; for fierceness makes error a fault, and truth discourtesy.
author: George Herbert

quote: A broken bone can heal, but the wound a word opens can fester forever.
author: Jessamyn West

quote: The best remedy for a short temper is a long walk.
author: Joseph Joubert

quote: Behind every argument is someone's ignorance.
author: Louis D. Brandeis

quote: Anger, if not restrained, is frequently more hurtful to us than the injury that provokes it.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: Anger is a wind which blows out the lamp of the mind.
author: Robert Green Ingersoll

quote: There was never an angry man that thought his anger unjust.
author: Saint Francis de Sales

quote: Reacting in anger or annoyance will not advance one's ability to persuade.
author: Ruth Bader Ginsburg

quote: Do not meddle in the affairs of Wizards, for they are subtle and quick to anger.
author: J. R. R. Tolkien

quote: I did not want to put myself on the line, as an Australian playing Britain's greatest comic actor. The fans of Sellers are obsessive, possessive - and aggressive. I did not want to risk their anger - or my own reputation.
author: Geoffrey Rush

quote: Anger is a manifestation of a deeper issue... and that, for me, is based on insecurity, self-esteem and loneliness.
author: Naomi Campbell

quote: I've always turned my anger inwards towards self-destruction.
author: Mackenzie Phillips

quote: I'm generally slow to anger, quick to forgive, and I take in information before making decisions. So no matter how controversial the decision, my general demeanour is to put on white lab coat and gloves and look at the evidence, weigh the arguments and see what makes sense.
author: Peter Blair Henry

quote: When you hold on to anger and unforgiveness, you can't move forward.
author: Mary J. Blige

quote: Sometimes the routes leading to feelings of anger are so convoluted and circuitous that it takes enormous skill to discern their original source, or fountainhead. But regardless of the reason for or the source of the anger or the relative ease or complexity in perceiving either the anger or its source - everybody, but everybody, gets angry.
author: Theodore Isaac Rubin

quote: President Obama and members of his administration constantly express rage and anger over events totally within their control. It's an odd and unsettling fact of American life that so many Americans seem to think that such expressions of frustration should substitute for actual competence.
author: Ben Shapiro

quote: Vengeance is the act of turning anger in on yourself. On the surface it may be directed at someone else, but it is a surefire recipe for arresting emotional recovery.
author: Jane Goldman

quote: Each person's drive to overwork is unique, and doing too much numbs every workaholic's emotions differently. Sometimes overwork numbs depression, sometimes anger, sometimes envy, sometimes sexuality. Or the overworker runs herself ragged in a race for attention.
author: Arlie Russell Hochschild

quote: I don't feel bitterness, I don't feel anger towards anybody. Fighting is never emotional to me.
author: Conor McGregor

quote: I'm very much inspired by things that anger me. If I see bigotry, stupidity, or injustice on the news, I'm inspired to find a way to make it into something comedic and relatable. Anger inspires me. Stupidity inspires me. My family inspires me. My accountant inspires me. Everything and anything, really.
author: Maysoon Zayid

quote: Violent anger makes me physically ill.
author: Langston Hughes

quote: My songs have always been frustrating themes, relationships that I've had. And now that I'm in love, I expect it to be really happy, or at least there won't be half as much anger as there was.
author: Kurt Cobain

quote: The ego mind both professes its desire for love and does everything possible to repel it, or if it gets here anyway, to sabotage it. That is why dealing with issues like control, anger, and neediness is the most important work in preparing ourselves for love.
author: Marianne Williamson

quote: In plain terms, a child is a complicated creature who can drive you crazy. There's a cruelty to childhood, there's an anger.
author: Maurice Sendak

quote: I think my passion is misinterpreted as anger sometimes. And I don't think people are ready for the message that I'm delivering, and delivering with a sense of violent love.
author: Charlie Sheen

quote: The spiritual message is we lose our lives in pleasing others; if you're the good child who pleases Mommy and Daddy but internalizes anger, you're setting yourself up for disease.
author: Bernie Siegel

quote: Anger is an unnecessary emotion. Loads of stuff in life can trigger it, but what matters is how you react. I choose not to react.
author: Nicola Adams

quote: Anger is just not who I am, and I don't think it's what voters in the 6th district want. They want respectful, decent representation that contrasts so starkly with what we have in Washington.
author: Jon Ossoff

quote: It's important to remember that the animals are not grieving with us. They're very accepting. They're not lying there thinking 'How could you do this to me? Why aren't you keeping me going?' Pets don't do the human things of guilt and anger and recrimination that we do. They come and go with great acceptance.
author: Jon Katz

quote: Let there be a door to thy mouth, that it may be shut when need arises, and let it be carefully barred, that none may rouse thy voice to anger, and thou pay back abuse with abuse.
author: Saint Ambrose

quote: My anger with the US was not at first, that they had used that weapon - although that anger came later.
author: Wilfred Burchett

quote: I want to express myself to feel that what I feel is real. My joy, my pain, my anger.
author: Annabella Sciorra

quote: I started writing because there's an absence of things I was familiar with or that I dreamed about. One of my senses of anger is related to this vacancy - a yearning I had as a teenager... and when I get ready to write, I think I'm trying to fill that.
author: Ntozake Shange

quote: People are fed up with the way things are. There is a lot of bitterness out there, a lot of anger about a lack of jobs and concerns for the next generation.
author: Gary Lineker

quote: Love implies anger. The man who is angered by nothing cares about nothing.
author: Edward Abbey

quote: Every time you get angry, you poison your own system.
author: Alfred A. Montapert

quote: He who is incapable of feeling strong passions, of being shaken by anger, of living in every sense of the word, will never be a good actor.
author: Sarah Bernhardt

quote: No one's banging down my door. People see the way I look, and they don't feel threatened, but they should watch out for me. They don't know there's a steel rod that drives me. I get ticked off, and the rage just gets me going. My motor is anger.
author: Tim Daly

quote: Somebody hits me, I'm going to hit him back. Even if it does look like he hasn't eaten in a while.
author: Charles Barkley

quote: We're comfortable with women in certain roles but not comfortable with women expressing anger or fully accepting their power. The most daring question a woman can ask is, 'What do I want?'
author: Libba Bray

quote: Wars spring from unseen and generally insignificant causes, the first outbreak being often but an explosion of anger.
author: Thucydides

quote: I don't think your ability to fight has anything to do with how big you are. It's to do with how much anger is in you.
author: Amy Winehouse

quote: One of the most interesting things about the cognitive theory is the idea that anger and interpersonal conflict ultimately result from a mental con. In other words, you're telling yourself things that aren't entirely true when you're fighting with someone.
author: David D. Burns

quote: I think Donald Trump taps into an anger that I hear every day. People are angry that a commonsense thing like securing the border or ending sanctuary cities is somehow considered extreme. It's not extreme it's common sense. We need to secure the border.
author: Carly Fiorina

quote: When you are offended at any man's fault, turn to yourself and study your own failings. Then you will forget your anger.
author: Epictetus

quote: Extremism thrives amid ignorance and anger, intimidation and cowardice.
author: Hillary Clinton

quote: Anger begins with folly, and ends with repentance.
author: Pythagoras

quote: A man must fortify himself and understand that a wise man who yields to laziness or anger or passion or love of drink, or who commits any other action prompted by impulse and inopportune, will probably find his fault condoned; but if he stoops to greed, he will not be pardoned, but render himself odious as a combination of all vices at once.
author: Apollonius of Tyana

quote: My father was so very afraid. I felt it in the sting of his black leather belt, which he applied with more anxiety than anger, my father who beat me as if someone might steal me away, because that was exactly what was happening all around us.
author: Ta-Nehisi Coates

quote: I've chosen my wedding ring large and heavy to continue forever. But exactly because of that all the time that Dave and I have an argument I feel it like handcuffs, and on anger time I throw it in a basket. Poor Dave, he bought me three wedding rings already!
author: Carmen Miranda

quote: In the heat of our campaigns, we have all become accustomed to a little anger and exaggeration. Yet, on the whole, our political process has served us well.
author: Edmund S. Muskie

quote: Take the high road. No matter how much strife, and consternation, frustration and anger you might be confronted with - don't go to that level.
author: Tim Gunn

quote: As long as anger, paranoia and misinformation drive our political debate, there are unhinged souls among us who will feel justified in turning to violent remedies for imagined threats.
author: David Horsey

quote: I am ready to accept all accusations, allegations, anger - but I have to succeed.
author: Boris Trajkovski

quote: The intoxication of anger, like that of the grape, shows us to others, but hides us from ourselves.
author: John Dryden

quote: Anger is as a stone cast into a wasp's nest.
author: Pope Paul VI

quote: Anger can be a problem, but it has tremendous potential, too. It's just figuring out what to do with it.
author: Sean Penn

quote: You know how big love is? Love is big. love can hold anger love can even hold hatred.
author: Alice Walker

quote: I was filled with hate and anger. But during my trial, something decisive happened: Amnesty International adopted me as a prisoner of conscience, and it was an unbelievable feeling to know that there is someone fighting for you on the outside. Amnesty's 'soft' approach made me seriously consider alternatives to revenge.
author: Maajid Nawaz

quote: It isn't enough just to scream at the Occupy Wall Street demonstrations. We need our political system to start reflect this anger back into, 'How do we fix it? How do we get the economy going again?'
author: Colin Powell

quote: Freedom of expression is tested during times of anger and conflict and enables all opinions and outraged expressions of dissent that we may not want to hear. But even for this there have to be limits.
author: Yair Lapid

quote: Arguments only confirm people in their own opinions.
author: Booth Tarkington

quote: You want to see an angry person? Let me hear a cell phone go off.
author: Jim Lehrer

quote: The poor monkey, quietly seated on the ground, seemed to be in sore trouble at this display of anger.
author: Henry Walter Bates

quote: I think people should be angry at things that are worthy of anger. Injustice is outrageous and deserves outrage.
author: Chris Hayes

quote: The injunction to be nice is used to deflect criticism and stifle the legitimate anger of dissent.
author: Malcolm Gladwell

quote: Anger will never disappear so long as thoughts of resentment are cherished in the mind. Anger will disappear just as soon as thoughts of resentment are forgotten.
author: John Dryden

quote: Anger is like those ruins which smash themselves on what they fall.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: There's a lot of bitterness, there's a lot of anger out there. We all have to work hard to heal those wounds.
author: Allen Boyd

quote: A little anger is a good thing if it isn't on your own behalf, if it's for others deserving of your anger, your empathy.
author: David Simon

quote: When I was younger, I was terrified to express anger because it would often kick-start a horrible reaction in the men in my life. So I bit my tongue. I was left to painstakingly deal with the aftermath of my avoidance later in life, in therapy or through the lyrics of my songs.
author: Alanis Morissette

quote: I had a trainer during 'Spiderman,' and I discovered I have deep-seated rage when I'm holding heavy weights over my head. Whatever dormant anger I have in me, that's where it comes out. That's not the kind of working out I want to do.
author: Emma Stone

quote: Relationships based on deals between leaders or ruling elites tend to collapse amid popular anger.
author: Stephen Kinzer

quote: I grew up here, and it's always been a very diverse community. So for people to come out and say that there's some long-standing anger or there's a history of racial tension is absolutely ridiculous. There's not a black-white divide in Ferguson.
author: James Knowles III

quote: Anger can be a useful emotion; it's built into our genetic code to help with self preservation. But it can also be destructive, even when it is justified.
author: Michael Hayden

quote: I don't think it's good to run on anger, but it's really great when that's the first couple of gallons in your tank - when you've had enough, and you're just pissed off enough to go for it. In a lot of ways, that sort of environment can be a catapult for a great situation.
author: Josh Homme

quote: I have a right to my anger, and I don't want anybody telling me I shouldn't be, that it's not nice to be, and that something's wrong with me because I get angry.
author: Maxine Waters

quote: Every child senses, with all the horse sense that's in him, that any parent is angry inside when children misbehave and they dread more the anger that is rarely or never expressed openly, wondering how awful it might be.
author: Benjamin Spock

quote: Never do anything when you are in a temper, for you will do everything wrong.
author: Baltasar Gracian

quote: The world needs anger. The world often continues to allow evil because it isn't angry enough.
author: Bede Jarrett

quote: Anger is a momentary madness, so control your passion or it will control you.
author: G. M. Trevelyan

quote: No man can think clearly when his fists are clenched.
author: George Jean Nathan

quote: Anger is a short madness.
author: Horace

quote: My father was often angry when I was most like him.
author: Lillian Hellman

quote: Anger cannot be dishonest.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: One should not lose one's temper unless one is certain of getting more and more angry to the end.
author: William Butler Yeats

quote: What starts the process, really, are laughs and slights and snubs when you are a kid. If your anger is deep enough and strong enough, you learn that you can change those attitudes by excellence, personal gut performance.
author: Richard M. Nixon

quote: Wise anger is like fire from a flint: there is great ado to get it out; and when it does come, it is out again immediately.
author: Edward Everett Hale

quote: Anger may repast with thee for an hour, but not repose for a night; the continuance of anger is hatred, the continuance of hatred turns malice.
author: Francis Quarles

quote: I know, to banish anger altogether from one's breast is a difficult task. It cannot be achieved through pure personal effort. It can be done only by God's grace.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Anger and hate against one we love steels our hearts, but contempt or pity leaves us silent and ashamed.
author: Edgar Rice Burroughs

quote: Although you may spend your life killing, You will not exhaust all your foes. But if you quell your own anger, your real enemy will be slain.
author: Nagarjuna

quote: Life is precious and there's not a lot of room for anger.
author: Fran Drescher

quote: Generalised anger and frustration is something that gets you in the studio, and gets you to work - though it's not necessarily evident in anything that's finished.
author: Bruce Nauman

quote: It is typical of women to fester and ferment over disappointments, slights, annoyances, angers, etc.
author: Laura Schlessinger

quote: In general I was a good kid. It usually took a lot to make me mad. But once I reached the boiling point, I lost all rational control. Totally without thinking, when my anger was aroused, I grabbed the nearest brick, rock, or stick to bash someone. It was as if I had no conscious will in the matter.
author: Ben Carson

quote: I don't have the feeling of being motivated by anger, revenge or frustration.
author: Agnes Obel

quote: So many women keep their anger inside and let it build until they explode and then people blow them off again.
author: Rosalind Wiseman

quote: Successful prime-time television of any genre produces some kind of emotional reaction in the viewers. There are a lot of different emotions to tap into. The emotion of the reward of discovery, the feeling of righteous anger, the feelings of pathos and sadness, or sentimentality of being moved by something.
author: Chris Hayes

quote: I originally wanted to embrace the imagery and forthrightness of rap music. There are some interesting, dynamic voices in rap. But I find most of it irresponsible in its overt violence and commercialization of anger. As artists, we believe we can will action through language. If that's the case, we have to take responsibility for what we say.
author: Yusef Komunyakaa

quote: It angers me when sustainability gets used as a buzz word. For 90 percent of the world, sustainability is a matter of survival.
author: Cameron Sinclair

quote: Whether one admired or was repulsed by the positions he took on matters foreign and domestic, it is undeniable that Reagan's ability to project anger was highly attractive to his most passionate supporters on the far right - and crucial to his political success.
author: Jackson Katz

quote: Books are in no hurry. An act of creation is in no hurry; it reads us, it privileges us infinitely. The notion that it is the occasion for our cleverness fills me with baffled bitterness and anger.
author: George Steiner

quote: To find gratitude and generosity when you could reasonably find hurt and resentment will surprise you. It will be so surprising because you will see so much of the opposite: people who have much more than others yet who react with anger when one advantage is lost or with resentment when an added gift is denied.
author: Henry B. Eyring

quote: The emotions in a song - the anger, aggression - have got to be legitimate.
author: Eminem

quote: There's very little dislike of Americans in the world, shown by repeated polls, and the dissatisfaction - that is, the hatred and the anger - they come from acceptance of American values, not a rejection of them, and recognition that they're rejected by the U.S. government and by U.S. elites, which does lead to hatred and anger.
author: Noam Chomsky

quote: Since the day I was born, wrestling has sustained me and my family. It's the way my father fed me; it's the way I feed my kids. More importantly, wrestling is my greatest release. It's been such a blessing for me. I can step into the ring and let it all go - all my anger, all my frustration, all my pain.
author: Eddie Guerrero

quote: Self-pity, a dominant characteristic of sociopaths, is also the characteristic that differentiates heroic storytelling from psychological rumination. When you talk about your experiences to shed light, you may feel wrenching pain, grief, anger, or shame. Your audience may pity you, but not because you want them to.
author: Martha Beck

quote: Your emotions are exposed when you play golf: humility, pride, anger, it all comes out with each swing. You lay it all on the line.
author: Bryant Gumbel

quote: I don't like greed, I don't like ignorance. I really don't like anger. But I love love.
author: David Crosby

quote: Anger is energising. The opposite of anger is depression, which is anger turned inward.
author: Gloria Steinem

quote: Being irrational and out of control is what happens in real life. Not cautiously choreographing your anger or your emotions, losing yourself in them is what happens in real life.
author: Margot Robbie

quote: I think I have a normal threshold of anger, but it's true that I am, by nature, belligerent.
author: Gore Vidal

quote: Maybe it's stress or anger or adrenaline or disillusionment or a bullying nature or simple fear of getting killed themselves, but there is a problem if a cop cannot tell the difference between a menacing gangster and the far more common person they encounter whose life is a little frayed and messy.
author: David Horsey

quote: The idea that the law should punish what is rude; that government should protect our tender sensibilities from those who would - quite often with shallow motivations but sometimes with deeper and more serious complaints - challenge our national certainties and rituals, should alarm and anger us.
author: Nick Harkaway

quote: I am not deaf. I hear the anger. I see the dissatisfaction, and I have to go faster.
author: Francois Hollande

quote: What's often not acknowledged about depression is how much anger is in it.
author: Margo Jefferson

quote: If you're with a close friend, your anger may raise his blood pressure as well as your own, whereas loving feelings may lower blood pressure in both of you.
author: Dean Ornish

quote: I feel truth, beauty, love, grief, anger, intimacy & alive in my body... Women in the global south live in their bodies much more than we in the global north. Not as distracted by patriarchy's controlling images - They know power is in their bodies. I am deeply grateful for the women who showed me the way home.
author: Jodie Evans

quote: There is a latent anger in a lot of people that went to boarding school at an early age. I was eight. And I loved it over the five years, but I think the adjustments for eight-year-olds are a lot. And I think it informs who you are for a long, long time.
author: Damian Lewis

quote: So many people live with anger and unforgiveness, and many of them are Christians.
author: Joyce Meyer

quote: You have to understand the Newark Riots - a lot of people understand that the pain was the initial explosion of anger and alienation, but after that, the response, sending the National Guard troops - a lot of violence was carried out and perpetrated by those who were allegedly coming here to protect residents.
author: Cory Booker

quote: When you fight, anger drives up testosterone in both men and women.
author: Helen Fisher

quote: In many ways, anger is a misdirected plea for love.
author: Karen Salmansohn

quote: Anger, if used properly, might be for a cause, like helping feed children or stopping abuse somewhere. When we understand that every quality has importance and value, then we open up to this. Shining a light on these shadow qualities gives it balance.
author: Debbie Ford

quote: The world in general doesn't know what to make of originality; it is startled out of its comfortable habits of thought, and its first reaction is one of anger.
author: W. Somerset Maugham

quote: I would be pleased if someone would invent a pill to remove my impatience, moodiness, and occasional bursts of anger. But if they did, I wouldn't be able to write my novels or paint.
author: Orhan Pamuk

quote: Public anger over bank bailouts was as much about fairness as the billions of dollars spent.
author: Nina Easton

quote: The Occupy movement found places where people who were feeling that anger could come and share it - and that is, as we all know, extremely important in any political movement. The Occupy sites became a way you could gauge the levels of anger and discontent.
author: Arundhati Roy

quote: Christ hath instituted Baptism as a bath, to wash away the anger, and hath put into us the Noble Stone, viz. the water of eternal life, for an earnest-penny, so that instantly in our childhood we might be able to escape the wrath.
author: Jakob Bohme

quote: Like the marriage contract you entered into, your divorce is a legal transaction. Treat it that way. Try not to let emotion, hurt, fear or anger dictate the circumstances of your discussions or negotiations.
author: Laura Wasser

quote: Deep down, my mom had long suspected I was gay... Much of her anger and hurt came from her sense of betrayal that she was the last to be told.
author: Chaz Bono

quote: Violence is a problem we all want to solve. I want to make sure that kids learn to deal with anger by learning how to talk with people to solve problems. Here in the United States Senate I want to make sure we have safe schools, safe neighborhoods and good things for kids to do after school!
author: Patty Murray

quote: That feeds anger, and I mean when we went and at last thank heavens got towards peace in Northern Ireland we went for justice within Northern Ireland as well as using security well, as well as a political settlement, but surely that is the lesson.
author: Clare Short

quote: Imagine a thousand more such daily intrusions in your life, every hour and minute of every day, and you can grasp the source of this paranoia, this anger that could consume me at any moment if I lost control.
author: Jack Henry Abbott

quote: Fantastic tyrant of the amorous heart. How hard thy yoke, how cruel thy dart. Those escape your anger who refuse your sway, and those are punished most, who most obey.
author: Matthew Prior

quote: The death of Garang has unfortunately unleashed emotions of anger; some genuine, others cultivated by elements who wanted to pit one group of Sudanese against another.
author: Salva Kiir Mayardit

quote: All I do is have fun. When I'm not working, it's about making people laugh. I love making jokes about things. Even when someone's mad at me, I'll deflect anger with humor. My days are filled with laughter. If I'm not laughing, I'm not happy.
author: Drew Fuller

quote: Anger is implanted in us as sort of sting, to make us gnash with our teeth against the devil, to make us vehement against him, not to set us in array against each other.
author: Richard Savage

quote: When anger rushes unrestrained to action, like a hot steed, it stumbles on its way. The man of thought strikes deepest and strikes safely.
author: Richard Savage

quote: I think, often, when you are in just a lot of pain, it comes out as anger.
author: Nell Hudson

quote: To anger female voters in America is to tread on the tiger's tail. Women turn out in huge numbers, and they are well aware of how their bodies work and what they need.
author: Henry Rollins

quote: People are always angry at America. They're absolutely certain that America either caused their problems or is deliberately not fixing their problems. But the anger is always directed at America and never at Americans.
author: P. J. O'Rourke

quote: Abstract anger is great for rhetorical carrying on. You can go on endlessly about the post office, but it doesn't mean you're mad at your mailman.
author: P. J. O'Rourke

quote: In Israel, waves of anger and fear circulate all the time, but so do jokes and gossip and silky evening breezes. So, too, in America.
author: P. J. O'Rourke

quote: Obama and his attack dogs have nothing but hate and anger in their hearts and spew it whenever possible.
author: Donald Trump

quote: A large part of mankind is angry not with the sins, but with the sinners.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: The deferring of anger is the best antidote to anger.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: I think that to acknowledge a new generation is to acknowledge some degree of obsolescence in yourself, and that is very hard to do and often comes with undeniable anger.
author: Douglas Coupland

quote: Chekhov was capable of casually tossing off deplorable comments in his letters, combined with a very modern anger against anti-Semitism.
author: Tom Stoppard

quote: I've had no problem harnessing anger.
author: Clint Eastwood

quote: To me, it's OK to have differences. But we don't have to be mad about it. You know? And I think that's where sometimes we get so passionate that we - you know, it turns into anger.
author: Joel Osteen

quote: Hatred is inveterate anger.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: Hatred is settled anger.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: There's nothing wrong with anger provided you use it constructively.
author: Wayne Dyer

quote: There's a lot of anger in the Twitter-verse, as I've discovered. But there's a lot of love.
author: Joss Whedon

quote: My first reaction every time I delve into an episode of history that I don't know very much about is... my first reaction is anger that my teachers never taught me about it.
author: Steven Spielberg

quote: Listen, Bruce Lee fought out of anger. That's why they call it the 'Fists of Fury.' Michael Jackson danced with fury. I do stand up out of fury. I'm not mad at anybody. I'm not mad at any human being because I'm a human being.
author: Tracy Morgan

quote: Anger is certainly a kind of baseness, as it appears well in the weakness of those subjects in whom it reigns: children, women, old folks, sick folks.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: My own approach has always been to push intense emotions down and attempt to deal with them later. When I was younger, I was terrified to express anger because it would often kick-start a horrible reaction in the men in my life.
author: Alanis Morissette

quote: When someone says that I'm angry it's actually a compliment. I have not always been direct with my anger in my relationships, which is part of why I'd write about it in my songs because I had such fear around expressing anger as a woman.
author: Alanis Morissette

quote: It's a joke to think that anyone is one thing. We're all such complex creatures. But if I'm going to be a poster child for anything, anger's a gorgeous emotion. It gets a bad rap, but it can make great changes happen.
author: Alanis Morissette

quote: What influenced me was Tori Amos, who was unapologetic about expressing anger through music, and Sinead O'Connor. Those two in particular were really moving for me, and very inspiring, before I wrote 'Jagged Little Pill.'
author: Alanis Morissette

quote: Anger has been a really big deal for women: how can we express it without feeling that, as the physically weaker sex, we won't get killed. The alpha-woman was burned at the stake and had her head chopped off in days of old.
author: Alanis Morissette

quote: Pundits talk about 'populist rage' as a way to trivialize the anger and fear coursing through the middle class.
author: Elizabeth Warren

quote: I do have anger management issues. Not clinical. Probably no more than most people.
author: Andy Serkis

quote: My therapist says I still haven't got in touch with my anger. Maybe one day I'm going to explode. But I'm still really happy. I know it looks like a strange and painful upbringing - all those experiences led me to the paths that I'm on now.
author: Drew Barrymore

quote: Fighting in the ring or cage is very much different from fighting in the street. Fighting in the street is very much fueled by anger, pride, and male dominance and ego.
author: Joel Edgerton

quote: Anger is wonderful. It keeps you going. I'm angry about bankers. About the government.
author: Terry Pratchett

quote: President Obama clearly cannot run on his record. All he's offering is more of the same. That's not good. Look at the economy. It's stagnating. And so, what they're now going to try and do is bring this campaign down to little things, distractions, distortions, smear, fear, anger, frustration.
author: Paul Ryan

quote: I'm not someone who feels anger on particular issues.
author: Theresa May

quote: The sense of anger I had when I was younger is something I thought would never go away. Over time, it's something you get almost bored with.
author: Chris Cornell

quote: I turned to music originally because of my past and needing a release or an outlet to get out anger or frustration or hurt.
author: Christina Aguilera

quote: I'm very much aware of the dangers of becoming a cliche. Mr. Anger, someone who gets meaner, angrier on record.
author: Trent Reznor

quote: Emotional life grows out of an area of the brain called the limbic system, specifically the amygdala, whence come delight and disgust and fear and anger.
author: Nancy Gibbs

quote: Hatred is an affair of the heart contempt that of the head.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: Until recently, we regarded love as supernatural. We were willing to study the brain chemistry of fear and depression and anger but not love.
author: Helen Fisher

quote: First and foremost, we need to be the adults we want our children to be. We should watch our own gossiping and anger. We should model the kindness we want to see.
author: Brene Brown

quote: Allowing children to show their guilt, show their grief, show their anger, takes the sting out of the situation.
author: Martha Beck

quote: I don't think enough players channel the energy of the crowd. If it's done properly, and you don't let anger overwhelm and distract you, it's like a shot of adrenaline in the arm, and it gets the crowd pumped up.
author: John McEnroe

quote: As I got older and started moving up the ranking, the matches got more important, and my emotions ratcheted up. I guess I hid my real feelings behind the anger.
author: John McEnroe

quote: The dog is often quick to resent a kick, be it from man or beast, but I have never known him to show anger at the door that slammed to and hit him. Probably, if the door held him by his tail or his limb, it would quickly receive the imprint of his teeth.
author: John Burroughs

quote: Fair peace becomes men ferocious anger belongs to beasts.
author: Ovid

quote: Like fragile ice anger passes away in time.
author: Ovid

quote: One of the interesting things about comedy is it's tension release, and nothing creates tension faster than anger.
author: Lewis Black

quote: When you create an economy where you subsidize corporate profits through a welfare program and food stamps in order to keep wages low in some perverse pursuit of 'competiveness,' than you reap the fruits of the anger that you sow.
author: Martin O'Malley

quote: I'm an angry person, angrier than most people would imagine, I get flashes of anger. What works for me is working out when it's useful to use that anger.
author: Alan Alda

quote: I'm too mature to be angry.
author: Jesse Jackson

quote: Many are observing Ferguson and witnessing the anger, demonstrations, looting and vandalism and calling for quiet. But quiet isn't enough. The absence of noise isn't the presence of justice - and we must demand justice in Ferguson and the other 'Fergusons' around America.
author: Jesse Jackson

quote: I have been to anger management twice. After the first session the lady was like, 'Baby, you don't seem that angry at all. You seem like a really nice guy.'
author: Kid Rock

quote: Sometimes, you have to get angry to get things done.
author: Ang Lee

quote: Democracies are slow to anger and hesitant to go to war: Voters don't want to sacrifice their children for the glory of a selfish king.
author: Michio Kaku

quote: My father had a real short fuse. He had a tough life - had to support his mother and brother at a very young age when his dad's farm collapsed. You could see his suffering, his terrible suffering, living a life that was disappointing and looking for another one. My father was full of terrifying anger.
author: Sam Shepard

quote: Unpleasant reading on the subject of anger tells us that there's not really anything wrong with it. In limited amounts. It can even be a good thing. A pressure valve.
author: Dick Cavett

quote: I think we all have a lot of darkness in our bellies. As an actor, the challenge of tapping into that, reaching down into that sadness or anger, is very therapeutic.
author: Kevin Bacon

quote: I started a youth center in Houston. The kids would come in and want to learn to box; they wanted to tear up the world, beat up the world. And I'd try to show them they didn't need anger. They didn't need all that killing instinct they'd read about. You can be a human being and pursue boxing as a sport.
author: George Foreman

quote: What people don't realize about Donald Trump - and I don't even know if Donald Trump realizes it - is that every tweet he unleashes against you... creates such a crescendo of anger.
author: Megyn Kelly

quote: Anger is one of the sinews of the soul.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: Lawyers are men who hire out their words and anger.
author: Horace

quote: He that would be angry and sin not, must not be angry with anything but sin.
author: John Ruskin

quote: Boxing was a way to express my anger. All of a sudden, I was expressing anger, and I was good at it. I was like a Jekyll and Hyde. Boxing helped me because I was fighting the anger out. I was knocking guys out.
author: Gerry Cooney

quote: Boxing gave me a voice to express the anger I felt for where I came from.
author: Gerry Cooney

quote: It's usually a big kind of vent of frustration or anger or sadness that puts me in the right frame of mind to write. It's such a cliche to say that artists write when they're down, but it's true for me. It's a relief to get out what's eating away at my heart or my soul or my head.
author: Ellie Goulding

quote: All improv turns into anger. All comedy improv basically turns into anger, because that's all people know how to do when they're improvising. If you notice shows that are improvising are generally people yelling at each other.
author: Albert Brooks

quote: I think anger and laughter are very close to each other, when you think about it.
author: Albert Brooks

quote: Even in my comedies, I don't take anger as a joke. I think anger and laughter are very close to each other, when you think about it. One of the things I like about a character: I always think it's fascinating when a character can turn on a dime and go from one emotion to another. I like watching that.
author: Albert Brooks

quote: The difference between anger and deep remorse - remorse is much fatter. It's a deeper feeling altogether. Anger is too easy an escape for my money.
author: John Hurt

quote: I've never felt that anger is a very powerful emotion.
author: John Hurt

quote: An angry people cannot create anything that is not imbued with anger.
author: John McAfee

quote: A theme that has always interested me is how women express anger, how women express violence. That is very much part of who women are, and it's so unaddressed. A vast amount of literature deals with cycles of violence about men, antiheroes. Women lack that vocabulary.
author: Gillian Flynn

quote: Well, all comedy starts with anger. You get angry, and its never for a good reason, right? You know its not a good reason. And then you try and work it from there.
author: Jerry Seinfeld

quote: Hizb ut-Tahrir spearheaded the radicalization of the 1990s and cultivated an atmosphere of anger.
author: Maajid Nawaz

quote: When daughters react with annoyance or even anger at the smallest, seemingly innocent remarks, mothers get the feeling that talking to their daughters can be like walking on eggshells: they have to watch every word.
author: Deborah Tannen

quote: Conversations with sisters can spark extremes of anger or extremes of love. Everything said between sisters carries meaning not only from what was just said but from all the conversations that came before - and 'before' can span a lifetime. The layers of meaning combine profound connection with equally profound competition.
author: Deborah Tannen

quote: I find there's this weird anger thing: Someone will approach me at the bar and say, 'Hey, can I buy you a drink?' And I'll say, 'No, I'm okay.' And then all of a sudden, there's this male anger flip, where they go, 'Oh, you know what? I wasn't even gonna buy you a drink, 'cause you're not even that cute anyway,' and walk away.
author: Hannah Simone

quote: Experts say you should never hit your children in anger. When is a good time? When you're feeling festive?
author: Roseanne Barr

quote: The modern progressive movement believes that dissenting language is objectionable, which then removes the brakes between anger and violence.
author: Greg Gutfeld

quote: A lot of artists think they want anger. But a real, strong, bitter anger occupies the mind, leaving no room for creativity.
author: David Lynch

quote: Anger clearly has its proper place at work, which is neither wholly absent nor ever present. The manager who is an emotional blank is just as hard to work for as the volcanic boss, and both can do great harm by setting an unhelpful example for what kind of emotional expression is expected and accepted.
author: Julian Baggini

quote: The most powerful force in American politics is not anger, it's nostalgia.
author: Pete Hamill

quote: If people think I'm angry, I don't want to burst anybody's bubble. I like sometimes for people to be afraid of me. But it's not really anger; it's discipline.
author: Grace Jones

quote: Basically, it's in your best mental interest to release your anger so you can see the world more clearly around you and seek better solutions for finding the happy, love-filled life you desire and deserve.
author: Karen Salmansohn

quote: Often, overeating is a way to punish yourself for the anger and resentment you're feeling - either at yourself or someone else.
author: Karen Salmansohn

quote: If your partner is angry with you, recognize that his anger is a misdirected plea for love. Your partner's simply upset because he feels something you said or did was a sign of not loving him enough.
author: Karen Salmansohn

quote: Anger in the black community towards Republicans is established and immutable.
author: Bob Beckel

quote: When our neighbor's personality possesses harsh qualities, we show our love by not voluntarily provoking those qualities in any way. Past experience shows us what upsets a person, so in their presence we are careful not to do or say those things that cause anger. We are self-effacing.
author: Mother Angelica

quote: When anyone arouses my anger, I will immediately pray for them and regain my peace of soul.
author: Mother Angelica

quote: You look at 30 Seconds to Mars, and you don't think, 'Ooh, I bet they're angry.' No one really does anger these days. I suppose it's a turn-off.
author: Peter Hook

quote: Staring prejudice in the face imposes a cruel discipline: to structure your anger, to achieve a certain dignity, an angry dignity.
author: Ellen Ullman

quote: Anger is so constructive.
author: John Cameron Mitchell

quote: I've been in government and politics my entire career, and while I try to keep a level head and a reasonable tone in my commentary, even I can lose my head sometimes and let anger bubble over and burst out. It feels gross, looks ugly, and leaves a lasting mark.
author: Dana Perino

quote: It angers me to see armed defenders at the bottom of Lost Cause statues, adding a renewed threat of violence to icons that are themselves part of an ideology of violence and intimidation.
author: Ryan Holiday

quote: You see all the movies where people say, 'Don't fight out of anger'? They say that for a reason.
author: Donald Cerrone

quote: For me, the interesting thing about anorexia is that you show your wound. There's no hiding it. So my anger and sense of disappointment, all the stuff I was out of touch with, became this visible rebuke to my parents.
author: Marti Noxon

quote: Anger is a good motivator.
author: James Dyson

quote: When I interviewed John McCain in 2000 about whether he had taken medication for his anger, I remember thinking, 'Let's see how this is going to work.'
author: John Dickerson

quote: Anger is one of those emotions that doesn't follow the letter of the law. It speaks before it thinks. It rears up on its hind legs and charges.
author: Lynn Coady

quote: When you're not sure your anger is justified, the thing to do is ask yourself exactly where it's coming from.
author: Lynn Coady

quote: What we Americans go through to pick a president is not only crazy and unnecessary but genuinely abusive. Hundreds of millions of dollars are spent in a craven, cynical effort to stir up hatred and anger on both sides.
author: Matt Taibbi

quote: George wrote Taxman, and I played guitar on it. He wrote it in anger at finding out what the taxman did. He had never known before then what could happen to your money.
author: Paul McCartney

quote: There's a lot of anger in 'Queen of Denmark,' and that's me getting political.
author: John Grant

quote: I have not one shred of anger in my heart against Netanyahu or his wife.
author: Naftali Bennett

quote: I get angry at a principle, not a person.
author: Norman Schwarzkopf

quote: I have rage and anger issues. So I get mad about stuff in real life, and then I yell about it onstage, and luckily, something funny ends up coming out. What I'll do is tape-record it, and it will end up coming out even funnier. And I add more punch lines.
author: Lisa Lampanelli

quote: I don't like anybody to be angry with me. I'd rather have friends.
author: B. B. King

quote: Shock, confusion, fear, anger, grief, and defiance. On Sept. 11, 2001, and for the three days following the worst terrorist attack on U.S. soil, President George W. Bush led with raw emotion that reflected the public's whipsawing stages of acceptance.
author: Ron Fournier

quote: When I first started, my songs were the politics of anger. As I got older and hopefully wiser, I wanted to be part of the politics of answers.
author: Michael Franti

quote: Whoever incites anger has a strong insurance against indifference.
author: Philip Stanhope, 4th Earl of Chesterfield

quote: I think I'm basically the same guy I always was. Maybe I've learned, through experience, to rein in some of the anger and temper they say redheads normally have.
author: Willie Nelson

quote: A lot of these guys come up and say, 'Man, you were my influence, the way you thrashed the drums.' They don't seem to understand I was thrashing in order to hear what I was playing. It was anger, not enjoyment - and painful.
author: Butch Trucks

quote: We do have our challenges. Some things don't always work right in Washington, and the anger you see from the electorate, I think, is a reflection of what's not working right.
author: Bill Flores

quote: I was being very bad because I didn't know how to express myself. Music gave me an outlet to express myself and channel that anger.
author: Tory Lanez

quote: Anger tears me up inside... My own... or anyone else's.
author: Betty White

quote: Our government is printing money, and it's degrading the living standard of every person in America. It's the cause of frustration, anger, and confusion.
author: Steve Wynn

quote: When the Left agitates over government policies, it's considered righteous anger. When the Right - and much of the center - agitate, it's painted as the rantings of the criminally and violently insane.
author: Monica Crowley

quote: My passion and energy get mistaken for anger.
author: Gary Oldman

quote: I drank for about 25 years getting over the loss of my father and I took the anger out on myself. I did a good job at beating myself up at sometimes. I don't drink anymore but my alcoholic head occasionally says different. 'Nil By Mouth' was a love letter to my father because I needed to resolve some issues in order to be able to forgive him.
author: Gary Oldman
